intro: Veronica longifolia var. grayi, commonly known as Gray's longflower speedwell, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, blue to violet flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The leaves are typically opposite, linear to lanceolate, and covered in fine hairs. This variety is often found in rocky soils and open woodland areas, thriving in well-drained conditions. Its botanical features make it a valuable addition to native plant gardens and ecological restoration projects.
